resources.string:
"

&app_name; by &app_author;

&app_name; displays every permission declared by every app installed on your device.
The permissions that are listed are declared by the displayed app. These permissions are
not displayed as they are used by each app, only as
they are declared by each app. This is helpful on scoping out all the
permissions that are usable on your device and whether they are revocable. &app_name;
is not an app manager.

What is '&permlist_item_revocable_title;'?

If a listed permission has a &permlist_item_revocable_title; tag
it means the permission is revocable from an app if it is using that permission. This
means you can deny this permission from the app via App Settings or adb.

Third Party Libraries

  •   FastScroll by L4 Digital
  •   ExpandableFab by Nambi
  •   Gson by Google
  •   AndroidAsync by JohnyDaDeveloper
"
